Medicine_tweet_137.News Finding: #climatechange expected to have negative impact on US electric grid  #climateandhealth #putkids1st #KidsEnvHealth
Medicine_tweet_137.Paper Finding: As such, even absent population and income changes, climate change will demand significant changes to the electric grid.
Medicine_tweet_137.News Context: #climatechange expected to have negative impact on US electric grid  #climateandhealth #putkids1st #KidsEnvHealth
Medicine_tweet_137.Paper Context: Overall, if the US had faced, over the past decade, the warmer climate that scientists predict for the future, our results show that much greater generation or storage capacity would have been needed. As such, even absent population and income changes, climate change will demand significant changes to the electric grid. ERCOT covers Texas only and can be thought of as more representative of warmer regions.

Medicine_tweet_143.News Finding: Pretty convincing evidence of negative selection detectable in cancer exomes in contrast to Martincorena et al Cell 2017. Nice eg in TERT w +ve selection in promoter but -ve selection in exons. Makes good sense!
Medicine_tweet_143.Paper Finding: In summary, the presented evidence supports a major role of negative selection in cancer evolution, which has been neglected in most studies, and ultimately challenges the current paradigm of an exclusive role of positive selection in cancer.
Medicine_tweet_143.News Context: Pretty convincing evidence of negative selection detectable in cancer exomes in contrast to Martincorena et al Cell 2017. Nice eg in TERT w +ve selection in promoter but -ve selection in exons. Makes good sense!
Medicine_tweet_143.Paper Context: Interestingly, AP-1 is essential for MHC complex I downregulation and immune escape upon HIV infection . In summary, the presented evidence supports a major role of negative selection in cancer evolution, which has been neglected in most studies, and ultimately challenges the current paradigm of an exclusive role of positive selection in cancer. These studies help to shed light upon the mechanisms underlying immune evasion and provide insights for improving cancer immunotherapies in the future.

Medicine_tweet_183.News Finding: Use of #antipsychotic meds increased among teens & young adults from 2006-2010 but not among kids 12 or younger.
Medicine_tweet_183.Paper Finding: This age profile refines earlier reports of steadily increasing rates of antipsychotic use across multiyear developmental categories of childhood to adolescence 28 to early adulthood.
Medicine_tweet_183.News Context: Use of #antipsychotic meds increased among teens & young adults from 2006-2010 but not among kids 12 or younger.
Medicine_tweet_183.Paper Context: There was a rise in antipsychotic use during childhood that extended into adolescence for females, followed by a plateau and a decline during the transition to early adulthood. This age profile refines earlier reports of steadily increasing rates of antipsychotic use across multiyear developmental categories of childhood to adolescence 28 to early adulthood. 29 A peak in antipsychotic use among males aged 11 to 17 years fits with treatment of conduct problems that commonly occur during adolescence.
Medicine_tweet_183.text:

PAPER FINDING: This age profile refines earlier reports of steadily increasing rates of antipsychotic use across multiyear developmental categories of childhood to adolescence 28 to early adulthood.
